abstract.text: Initializes a newly allocated ruler marker, associating it with (but not adding it to) a specified ruler view and assigning the attributes provided.

inlineContent.text: The ruler view with which to associate the ruler marker. This method raises an
if
is
The x or y position of the marker in the client view’s coordinate system, depending on whether the ruler view is horizontal or vertical.
The image displayed at the marker location. This method raises an
if
is
The point within the image positioned at the marker location, expressed in pixels relative to the lower-left corner of the image.
An initialized ruler marker object.

The image used to draw the marker must be appropriate for the orientation of the ruler. Markers may need to look different on a horizontal ruler than on a vertical ruler, and the ruler view neither scales nor rotates the images.
To add the new ruler marker to
, use either of NSRulerView’s
or
methods.
immediately puts the marker on the ruler, while
allows the client view to intercede in the addition and placement of the marker.
A new ruler marker can be moved on its ruler view, but not removed. Use
and
to change these attributes. The new ruler marker also has no represented object; use
to set one.
This method is the designated initializer for the NSRulerMarker class.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
A symbol on a ruler view, indicating a location for the graphics element it represents in the client of the ruler view.
The point in the receiver’s image that is positioned at the receiver’s location on the ruler view.
Initializes a newly allocated ruler marker, associating it with (but not adding it to) a specified ruler view and assigning the attributes provided.
A Boolean that indicates whether the user can move the receiver in its ruler view.
A Boolean that indicates whether the user can remove the receiver from its ruler view.
The location of the receiver in the coordinate system of the ruler view’s client view.
A ruler and the markers above or to the side of a scroll view’s document view.
to the receiver, without consulting the client view for approval.
based on the initial mouse-down or mouse-dragged event
The basic type for all floating-point values.
A point in a Cartesian coordinate system.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.

https://developer.apple.com/library/arch.title: Ruler and Paragraph Style Programming Topics
